Credit Spreads Signal

Corporate credit spreads as a funding-stress and risk appetite indicator.

As of 2026-01-01

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • The Credit Spreads signal (1) is currently in a NORMAL regime as of 2025-12-31, indicating stable corporate funding conditions. This represents a slight transition from an EASY regime in the preceding two months.
  • Conviction Band: Medium | Interpretation Confidence: High Confidence | Internal Conflict Flag: No.

Key Dynamics:

  • The composite Z-score (CSC_z) is -0.416047, which is within the [-0.5, +0.5) range for a NORMAL regime (1).
  • High Yield Option-Adjusted Spreads (HY OAS) remain low at 2.92, well below the 3.5% threshold that would indicate a more strained NORMAL or TIGHTENING regime (1).
  • Momentum in HY OAS (hy_d3m_ann_z) has turned positive (0.108252), suggesting some short-term upward pressure, while IG OAS momentum (ig_d3m_ann_z) is still negative (-0.242817).
  • Conditional Invalidation: A sustained rise in High Yield OAS above 3.5% or the composite Z-score (CSC_z) exceeding +0.5 would signal a shift to tightening conditions (1).

Scenario Balance:

  • Base Case dominant: Corporate funding conditions are expected to remain stable, given the current low absolute spread levels.
  • Upside secondary: A further decline in spreads, pushing the composite Z-score below -0.5, could return the signal to an EASY regime.
  • Downside residual: A material deterioration in economic outlook or increase in default risk could lead to spreads widening into a TIGHTENING or STRESSED regime.

Time Horizon & Aggregation:

  • Time Horizon: Cyclical (months). Credit spread dynamics typically reflect shifts in economic cycles and corporate health over several months.
  • Aggregation Weight Hint: Medium. As a key component of financial stress, it provides valuable input, but its current NORMAL state, while slightly less accommodative than recently, doesn't imply extreme macro shifts alone.

Macro Relevance:

  • Macro dimension informed: Credit conditions (1), financial stress (2), and risk sentiment.
  • Cycle position: Current low spread levels suggest a mid-cycle environment with adequate risk appetite.
  • Typical interaction: Often interacts with liquidity signals (3) and equity market volatility (VIX) (4) to gauge broader financial stress (1). Rising spreads typically precede equity drawdowns and slower capital expenditure (1).

Data & References:

  • ICE BofA US High Yield Index Option-Adjusted Spread (BAMLH0A0HYM2), latest observation 2025-12-31 (1).
  • ICE BofA US Corporate Master Option-Adjusted Spread (BAMLC0A0CM), latest observation 2025-12-31 (1).
  • The `CSC_z` and `CSC_regime` are most influential for the current state (1).
  • Additional public datasets: Capex Intent Signal (5) and Credit Conditions Signal (6) would improve depth for capital expenditure and overall credit stress insights.
